question: A non-finite verb agrees with the subject and conveys mood, tense, number, and person.
In subject-verb Agreements, it is the verb that impacts the subject.
Which sentence is correct?

Fill in the blanks:
Twenty percent of the work ……………….just site visits.

Is the sentence below grammatically correct?
Three-fourth of the interns are graduates.

Which sentence is grammatically correct?
1. Half of her family live in New Zealand.
2. Half of her family lives in New Zealand.
When sentences start with “there” or “here,” the subject will always be placed ………….. the verb, so care needs to be taken to identify it correctly.
When ‘majority’/’minority’ refer to an undetermined number greater or less than 50%, use a ……………………………… verb:

Which sentence is grammatically correct?
I. An 82% majority stand against this venture.
II. An 82% majority stands against this venture.

Fill in the blanks:
A majority of Indians ………………….voted against the quota system in education.

Which sentence has no errors?
I. 200 dollars is the price of this bag.
II. 200 dollars are the price of this bag.

Fill in the blanks:
117 km ...………………………….not a small distance.
Seven days in jail ……………. a long time for someone who committed no crime.

Is the sentence below grammatically correct?
These days the rich are getting richer.

Fill in the blanks:
The number of patients registered in the psychiatric ward ……………………………… 73.

Fill in the blanks:
A number of lawyers ………………………..present in the protest.
To which form of the verb, do we add an ‘s’ or ‘es’ to make it singular?

Which sentence is grammatically correct?
I. Half of the apple is gone.
II. Half of the apples are gone.

Which is the finite verb in the sentence below:
Jonathan likes to drink coffee.
Money, time and distance are frequently expressed by a ……………………… verb.
